sn46.1:4.2: “Mendicants, dragons grow and wax strong supported by the Himalayas, the king of mountains.
sn46.1:4.3: When they’re strong they dive into the pools. Then they dive into the lakes, the streams, the rivers, and finally the ocean. There they acquire a great and abundant body.
sn46.1:4.5: In the same way, a mendicant develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics, acquiring great and abundant good qualities.
sn46.1:4.6: And how does a mendicant develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics, acquiring great and abundant good qualities?
sn46.1:4.7: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening-factor of mindfulness, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn46.1:4.8: They develop the awakening-factor of investigation of principles …
sn46.1:4.9: They develop the awakening-factor of energy …
sn46.1:4.10: They develop the awakening-factor of rapture …
sn46.1:4.11: They develop the awakening-factor of tranquillity …
sn46.1:4.12: They develop the awakening-factor of samādhi …
sn46.1:4.13: They develop the awakening-factor of equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn46.1:4.14: That’s how a mendicant develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics, acquiring great and abundant good qualities.”
